clinical_study.brief_title: Pulmonary Rehabilitation and Self-esteem in Patients With COPD
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Pulmonary Rehabilitation on Self-esteem in Patients With COPD

brief_summary.textblock: the aim of this study is to evaluate the evolution of self-esteem during a pulmonary rehabilitation program, in COPD patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: PSI-6 is measured at the biginning and at the end of the pulmonary rehabilitation program (4 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: the physical self inventory- 6 (PSI-6) allows to evaluate self esteem

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the 6MWT is measured at the biginning and at the end of the pulmonary rehabilitation program (4 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: The 6-minute walk test allows to evaluate exercise capacity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: HAD is measured at the biginning and at the end of the pulmonary rehabilitation program (4 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: the hospital anxiety and depressive scale (HAD) measure the anxiety and depression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: SGRQ is measured at the biginning and at the end of the pulmonary rehabilitation program (4 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: the Saint-George respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) measure the quality of life

other_outcome.time_frame: MMRC is measured at the biginning and at the end of the pulmonary rehabilitation program (4 weeks)
other_outcome.description: The modified medical research Council dyspnea scale measure dyspnea

study_pop.textblock: COPD patients admitted to a pulmonary rehabilitation program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with stage 2 to 4 (A to D) COPD admitted to a pulmonary rehabilitation program
- Patient aged 18 or over
- Patient able to consent and having signed a consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient with pain, osteoarthritis or shoulder surgery
- Patient with a history of Pneumonectomy, lobectomy less than 6 months old
- Refusal of participation
- Patient with an inability to complete a pulmonary rehabilitation program in totality
- Pregnant or breast-feeding women
- Patient under tutorship or curatorship

reference.citation: Fox, K.R. et Corbin, C.B.The Physical Self-Perception Profile : Devlopment and Preliminary Validation. Journal of Sport and Exercise Psychology, 11(4), p. 408 430, 1989
